examples: The food looks good.
Good wine can make a meal.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
This information is as good as gold.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is satisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng thỏa mãn

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
The bad weather brought famine.
Don’t use bad language.
Bad manners will get you nowhere.
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is unsatisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng không thỏa mãn

examples: We want a deal.
The deal was completely open and above board.
You've got a deal!
Your friendship means a great deal to me.
She got the short end of the stick in the deal.
words.defineEn: (especially in business or politics) an agreement between two or more parties, on particular conditions
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt là trong kinh doanh hoặc chính trị) một thỏa thuận giữa hai hoặc nhiều bên, với những điều kiện cụ thể

examples: The goalie saved Johnson's long-range shot.
Save data frequently.
But a truck driver saved her bacon.
Save your breath, Tom.
To save a penalty.
words.defineEn: to keep money to spend later
words.defineVi: để giữ tiền để chi tiêu sau này

examples: The business is losing money.
Money can't buy happiness.
Money means nothing to him.
A lot of people give money to good causes.
My parents give me pocket money every week.
words.defineEn: something that people use to buy and sell goods and services, can be in the form of coins or paper bills
words.defineVi: thứ mà mọi người sử dụng để mua và bán hàng hóa và dịch vụ, có thể ở dạng tiền xu hoặc hóa đơn giấy

examples: You can find bargain books in mint condition at jumble sales.
She knows a bargain when she sees one.
She has a good nose for a bargain.
He drives a hard bargain, but we finally made a deal.
The company is believed to have struck a hard bargain.
words.defineEn: an item bought at a much lower price than usual
words.defineVi: một mặt hàng được mua với giá thấp hơn nhiều so với bình thường

examples: My father pays his bills at the beginning of the month.
Our efforts are finally paying dividends.
Not paying attention.
They both pay their employees badly.
No one paid them any attention.
words.defineEn: to give someone money in exchange for goods or services
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó tiền để đổi lấy hàng hóa hoặc dịch vụ

examples: Now we don't look at a lot of rip-off products, fake iPhones, fake iPods, things like that over on the main channel.
- These have got ta be one of the most blatant rip-offs of the AirPods Pro that I have ever seen.

We’ve seen this kind of criminal activity in all kinds of direct rip-off scams, but to do so to push fake news, and the fact that they can make enough money to support these large ecosystems of people, was actually pretty surprising.
words.defineEn: something that costs a lot more than its real value
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó có giá cao hơn rất nhiều so với giá trị thực của nó
